contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Political party |party_name = Civil Force |native_name = {{noitalics|{{nobold|公民力量}}}} |party_logo = [[Image:Civil Force Hong Kong.png]] |colorcode = #00a754 |leader1_title = Convener |leader1_name = [[Lau Kong-wah]] |foundation = December 1993 |ideology = [[Conservatism]] |position = [[Centre-right]] |national = [[Pro-Beijing camp]] |seats1_title = [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong|Legislative Council]] |seats1 = {{Infobox political party/seats|1|70|hex=#00a754}} |seats2_title = [[District Councils of Hong Kong|District Councils]] |seats2 = {{Infobox political party/seats|18|507|hex=#00a754}} |website = [http://www.civilforce.org.hk/ http://www.civilforce.org.hk/] }} '''Civil Force''' ({{zh|t=公民力量}}) is a community alliance in the [[Hong Kong]] [[Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China|Special Administrative Region]] of the [[People's Republic of China]]. It was established in 1993 by a former member of [[United Democrats of Hong Kong]], [[Lau Kong-wah]] and 8 other [[Sha Tin District Council|Sha Tin District Board]] members. The group is active on local district affairs in the [[Sha Tin District]] and [[Sai Kung District]]. Lau remains the convenor of Civil Force. Lau was defeated by [[Emily Lau]] in the 1991 and 1995 elections of the [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong]] (LegCo). In 1996, Lau secured a seat in the [[Provisional Legislative Council]]. He was elected into LegCo in since [[Hong Kong legislative election, 1998|1998 LegCo elections]] in the [[New Territories East (constituency)|New Territories East]] geographical constituency, after he joined the pro-[[Communist Party of China|Beijing]] [[Democratic Alliance for Betterment of Hong Kong]] (DAB). In 2003, due to the pro-Government stance of DAB especially on the issue of implementing [[Hong Kong Basic Law Article 23|Article 23 of the Basic Law]], the popularity of Lau, being a member of the DAB, was affected, and the Civil Force performed not as well in the [[Hong Kong local elections, 2003|2003 District Council elections]]. Campaigns of some of the members emphasise more on the banner of Civil Force and their local contributions, and did not mention the convenor's connection with the DAB. Lau himself lost the seat in the [[Kam To (constituency)|Kam To constituency]] for the [[Sha Tin District Council]] despite his long service in the district. The Civil Force retained 14 seats in the Sha Tin District Council, and 3 seats in the [[Sai Kung District Council]]. In the [[Hong Kong legislative election, 2012|2012 Legislative Council election]], Lau Kong-wah lost in the [[District Council (Second)]] constituency election while the newly-joined member Scarlett Pong failed to win a seat in the New Territories East constituency. Civil Force had not been represented in the Legislative Council for the first time. On 14 March 2013, LegCo member [[Lam Tai-fai]] told the press on that he had already joined the Civil Force on 1 January 2013, which made the organisation retained one seat in the Legislative Council.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://hk.news.yahoo.com/%E6%9E%97%E5%A4%A7%E8%BC%9D%E5%AB%81%E5%85%A5%E5%85%AC%E6%B0%91%E5%8A%9B%E9%87%8F-211003328.html|title=林大輝嫁入公民力量|newspaper=Ming Pao|date=15 March 2013|accessdate=29 April 2013|language=Chinese}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.civilforce.org.hk Web site of Civil Force] * [http://www.legco.gov.hk/general/english/members/yr04-08/lkw.htm Lau Kwong Wah, Hong Kong Legislative Council] {{Hong Kong political parties}} [[Category:Political parties in China]] [[Category:Political parties in Hong Kong]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1993]]
